title: Carney off to the United Arab Emirates tonight before heading to G20 summit
description: OTTAWA — Prime Minister Mark Carney is travelling to the United Arab Emirates tonight before making his way to South Africa for the G20 Leaders’ Summit later this week.

title: MPs pass Carney budget, avoid holiday election
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s minority Liberal government narrowly survived its third confidence vote in as many weeks on Monday, passing the federal budget by a vote of 170-168 and staving off a holiday election.

title: Mark Carney’s Failing Grade
description: Somehow, the Canadian PM has managed to blow past even Trudeau’s last spending estimate.

title: In the news today: PM travelling to UAE, alert system test, HBC art auction
description: Here is a roundup of stories from The Canadian Press designed to bring you up to speed… Carney heads to Abu Dhabi for investment talks Prime Minister Mark Carney is on his way to Abu Dhabi today, making him the first Canadian prime minister to visit the United Arab Emirates since 1983. His visit comes […]

title: Prime Minister Mark Carney departs for another overseas trip
description: PM will meet leaders in UAE, attend G20 summit in South Africa

title: Tom Flanagan: Louis Riel's leadership was ruinous for the Métis
description: And yet, Prime Minister Mark Carney celebrates him

title: Cost of bureaucracy balloons 80 per cent in 10 years: Public Accounts
description: OTTAWA, ON: The cost of the bureaucracy increased by $6 billion last year, according to newly released numbers in Public Accounts disclosures. The Canadian Taxpayers Federation is calling on Prime Minister Mark Carney to immediately shrink the bureaucracy.“The Public Accounts show the cost of the federal bureaucracy is out of control,” said Franco Terrazzano, CTF Federal Director. “Tinkering around the edges won’t cut it, Carney needs to take urgent action to shrink the bloated federal bureaucracy.”

title: Ex-NHLer Theo Fleury speaks out against Canadian PM Mark Carney's first federal budget: "The Communist takeover of Canada is complete"
description: Former NHLer Theo Fleury has condemned Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney's inaugural federal budget.

title: Canada Avoids Election as Carney’s Budget Narrowly Passes House
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney won a key budget vote by the slimmest of margins in Canada’s Parliament, ensuring the survival of his government.

title: OIL PIPELINE TO WEST COAST?: Danielle Smith’s deadline for Carney has passed
description: WATCH: Sun columnist Jay Goldberg on why Prime Minister Mark Carney needs to get moving with the major nation building projects Canada needs. What do YOU think? Tell us your thoughts in the comment section below or send us a Letter to the Editor for possible publication to torsun.editor@sunmedia.ca.  Letters must be 250 words or […]

title: GOLDBERG: Is Carney just stringing Canadians along on energy?
description: The federal government keeps talking — but Canadians are still waiting for action. The Grey Cup has come and gone. So, too, has Alberta Premier Danielle Smith’s deadline for Prime Minister Mark Carney to get on board with a west coast pipeline. When Carney announced his first raft of major projects back in September, Smith […]

title: Mark Carney booed during Grey Cup in Winnipeg. ‘We were cheered as well,’ PM says
description: The prime minster posted his own video of the event on social media but replaced audio of the crowd with music

title: In the news today: MPs to vote on Prime Minister Carney’s budget
description: Here is a roundup of stories from The Canadian Press designed to bring you up to speed… MPs to vote on Prime Minister Mark Carney’s first budget today Members of Parliament will today decide whether to vote in favour of Prime Minister Mark Carney’s budget or send the country back to the polls less than […]

title: Prime Minister Mark Carney faces mixed reaction during Grey Cup coin toss
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney kicked off the 112th Grey Cup in Winnipeg with the coin toss, drawing mixed reactions from fans amid pre-game performances and tailgate festivities.

title: Prime Minister Mark Carney met with cheers and boos at 112th Grey Cup game
description: WINNIPEG — Prime Minister Mark Carney was on hand in Winnipeg for the 112th Grey Cup game between the Saskatchewan Roughriders and Montreal Alouettes. Carney kicked off the championship game by doing the customary coin toss at centre field to determine which team chooses the first move. The prime minister was met with booing and […]

title: Churchill project gains steam as Carney and Kinew unveil new funding and shared vision
description: A renewed federal-provincial alliance is pushing forward a major northern infrastructure plan centred on the Port of Churchill, with both Prime Minister Mark Carney and Manitoba Premier Wab Kinew framing the project as a once-in-a-generation nation-building effort. In a joint announcement, Carney and Kinew said work is accelerating on what’s being called Port of Churchill […]

title: PBO slices through Carney's creative accounting
description: OTTAWA, ON: The Canadian Taxpayers Federation is calling on Prime Minister Mark Carney to cut spending following today’s bombshell Parliamentary Budget Officer report that criticizes the government’s definition of capital spending and promise to balance the operating budget.“The reality is that Carney is continuing on a course of unaffordable borrowing and the PBO report shows government messaging about ‘balancing the operating budget’ is not credible,” said Franco Terrazzano, CTF Federal Director. “Carney is using creative accounting to hide the spiralling debt.”

title: EDITORIAL: Three myths about the ‘clean economy’
description: The federal Liberals – starting with former prime minister Justin Trudeau and continuing under Mark Carney – sold their climate strategy to Canadians based on three myths. First, that it would be a huge job creator. Second, that Canada would hit the government’s industrial greenhouse gas emission reduction targets. Third, that most Canadian households would […]

title: New Brunswick mine added to major projects but opponents say it’ll do more harm than good
description: In New Brunswick, opponents of a mining project that made Prime Minister Mark Carney's nation-building projects say the proposal could do more harm than good,

title: Energy stocks rise on major projects enthusiasm, while U.S. stock markets were mixed
description: TORONTO — Canada’s main stock index finished higher on Friday amid gains in energy stocks following more major projects announcements, while U.S. markets were mixed. Theresa Shutt, chief investment officer at Harbourfront Wealth Management, said gains in the TSX energy sector came after some recent announcements by Prime Minister Mark Carney. On Thursday, Carney identified […]
